title: Rewrite mcpx in Go
description: Port Python implementation to Go for single-binary distribution and native concurrency. Key areas: CLI parsing, HTTP client, OAuth/PKCE flow, daemon mode with goroutines, Unix socket IPC.

title: Local MCP server process management
description:
mcpx manages local MCP server processes alongside its own daemon.

Config:
  servers.playwright.local.command = 'npx'
  servers.playwright.local.args = ['@playwright/mcp@latest', '--port', '8931']

Commands:
  mcpx --daemon        # Starts mcpx + all local servers
  mcpx --daemon-stop   # Stops everything
  mcpx --status        # Show running processes
  mcpx --logs <server> # Tail logs for a managed server

Behavior:
- Remote servers (no local config): just connect
- Local servers (has local config): start process, then connect
- Restart crashed local servers automatically
- Capture stdout/stderr to ~/.mcpx/logs/<server>.log

Future:
- TUI dashboard for status/logs

title: Explore Rube hybrid integration

title: Evaluate DrDroidLab betterstack-logs-mcp vs official
description:
Compare https://github.com/DrDroidLab/betterstack-logs-mcp against official BetterStack MCP.

Evaluation criteria:
- Tool coverage (which log operations supported?)
- Auth mechanism (API key handling)
- Transport (HTTP vs stdio)
- Response format quality
- Active maintenance

Goal: Determine which is better for mcpx integration testing.

title: Add threading support to daemon
description: Enable parallel agent queries via threading/goroutines in daemon mode. Currently single-threaded which blocks concurrent requests.
close_reason: Addressed in Go rewrite - goroutines in daemon.go

title: Onboarding skill for Claude Code / Codex / Cursor
description:
A skill that onboards mcpx into a project for AI coding tools.

Flow:
1. Check mcpx installed + daemon running
2. Show available servers from mcpx config
3. User selects which to use for this project
4. Test connections, list available tools
5. Generate CLAUDE.md / AGENTS.md / .cursorrules snippet
6. Optionally create project skill for easy MCP queries

Supports:
- Claude Code (CLAUDE.md)
- Codex (AGENTS.md)  
- Cursor (.cursorrules)
- Others as needed

Could be distributed as:
- mcpx --init-project (built-in)
- Standalone skill users install

title: Add --add and --remove commands for server management
description:
Simple CLI commands to manage servers.json without manual editing.

Usage:
  mcpx --add <name> <url>       # Add a server
  mcpx --remove <name>          # Remove a server

Behavior:
- Error if server already exists (no --force yet)
- No URL validation (trust user)
- No auto-auth (separate step)

Future enhancements (not in scope):
- --header flag for static auth
- --force to overwrite
- Interactive mode

comments.author: lakshminp
comments.text:
Updated scope:
- Add --header flag for auth headers
- Clarify HTTP/SSE only (not stdio)

Usage:
  mcpx --add <name> <url>
  mcpx --add <name> <url> --header 'Authorization: Bearer $TOKEN'
  mcpx --remove <name>

title: Evaluate Microsoft Playwright MCP with mcpx
description:
Test https://github.com/microsoft/playwright-mcp with mcpx.

Evaluation:
